scriptLines.text: The plains are vast, and you walk along them, humbled by the visions of the distant mountains.

"I didn't think humans were so interested in the affections of centaurs," she says, somewhat amused.  "I suppose I should thank you for your hospitality."
You lay motionless as she trots up to you, kneels, and lays her bow on the ground.  Without another word, she trots off, having already gotten her satisfaction with your too-small body.
